_header: Til horse foot thou never fraist
Subjects: women, against; chronicles, verse in; translations
_description: Warning against trusting women — one couplet translating a Latin aphorism from Babio in Fordun’s Scotichronicon (Book 14, Chap. 32)

CamCCC171.Transcription:
Til hors fote þu neuer fraisttil hondes toth no womannis
                    faith
CamCCC171.Note:
Written as prose. Robbins  and  Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins,   and  John L. Cutler.  
             Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965 has ‘traist’, which may be what is intended, but is
                    not what the scribe wrote.
